drake_hotline.name: Drake Hotline
drake_hotline.explanation: Caption1 should be something people reject, Caption2 should be something they approve instead.

examples.caption2: Sitting on the couch playing video games

uno_card.name: Uno Card
uno_card.explanation: Caption1 should be the thing to do, Caption2 should be the person,persons,organization etc. that refuses it.

two_buttons.name: Two Buttons
two_buttons.explanation: Caption1 and Caption2 should be the two conflicting options on the buttons, Caption3 should be the person or group sweating and struggling to choose.

batman_slap.name: Batman Slap
batman_slap.explanation: Caption1 should be what one person/group is saying or suggesting, Caption2 should be the harsh or dismissive response from the other person/group shutting them down.

distracted_bf.name: Distracted Bf
distracted_bf.explanation: Caption1 should be the person/group who is tempted, Caption2 should be what they are currently committed to or supposed to focus on, Caption3 should be the new tempting option they get distracted by instead.

boardroom_meeting_suggestion.name: Boardroom Meeting Suggestion
boardroom_meeting_suggestion.explanation:
Caption1 (Boss): Sets a goal or problem (“We need X”).
Function: Frame the brainstorming topic and implied constraints.

Caption2 (Team Member A): Safe, on-brand idea that seems aligned.
Function: Build a believable path.

Caption3 (Team Member B): Another safe idea, often incremental.
Function: Reinforce the “status-quo think.”

Caption4 (Team Member C): Contrarian or obvious-but-taboo idea (the twist).
Function: Deliver the joke; the visual shows them being thrown out the window.

examples.caption3: We should fix the bugs first!

examples.caption1: What should we name our new product?

am_i_the_only_one.name: Am I The Only One Around Here
am_i_the_only_one.explanation:
Caption1: Starts with “Am I the only one around here who/that…”
Function: Signal exasperation and set a broad category (habit, norm, pet peeve).

Caption2: The specific gripe or standard you wish others followed.
Function: Deliver the exact opinion/observation that feels “obvious” to you.

examples.caption1: AM I THE ONLY ONE AROUND HERE
examples.caption2: THAT THINKS CHINA WANTS TO RULE THE WORLD BY KILLING US ALL, I'M SURPRISED WE'RE NOT ALL CHEMICALLY CASTRATED YET!!!

examples.caption1: AM I THE ONLY ONE AROUND HERE
AM I THE ONLY ONE AROUND HERE
examples.caption2: WHO CAN'T SPELL 'APOCALYPSE' WITHOUT ASKING GOOGLE?

examples.caption1: AM I THE ONLY ONE AROUND HERE
AM I THE ONLY ONE AROUND HERE
examples.caption2: WHO DRINKS MEDICINE AND EXPECTS IMMEDIATE RESULTS?

ancient_aliens.name: Ancient Aliens
ancient_aliens.explanation:
Caption1: Presents a mysterious/complicated phenomenon as if it’s a puzzle.
Function: Set up an overblown mystery (architecture, coincidence, pattern).

Caption2: The laconic answer: “Aliens.” (or “I’m not saying it was aliens… but it was aliens.”)
Function: Punchline by offering a comically lazy, all-purpose explanation.

examples.caption1: WHEN THE BANK FORECLOSES ON YOUR PARENTS HOUSE
examples.caption2: WHOSE BASEMENT WILL YOU LIVE IN

examples.caption1: I'M NOT SAYING IT WAS QUARANTINE...
THE FIRST RULE OF PANDEMICS IS
I'M NOT SAYING THEY'RE ILLEGAL IMMIGRANTS...

bernie_i_am_once_again_asking.name: Bernie I Am Once Again Asking For Your Support
bernie_i_am_once_again_asking.explanation: Caption1 is the setup, often humorously portraying the person making a repeated or desperate plea. Caption2 contains the iconic phrase 'I am once again asking for...' followed by the object of the request.

examples.caption1: Me at the restaurant manager after eating a salad
examples.caption2: I am once again asking for some pasta
I am once again asking for you to stop barking at the mailman

examples.caption1: Me, my entire life so far:
examples.caption2: Can I please get some coochie?
I am once again asking for you to be found
"So if I'm not being detained, I'm free to go?"

blank_nut_button.name: Blank Nut Button
blank_nut_button.explanation: Caption1 represents the person or group experiencing the strong urge. Caption2 describes the action or object that they have a powerful, often uncontrollable, impulse to engage with or have.

captain_picard_facepalm.name: Captain Picard Facepalm
captain_picard_facepalm.explanation:
Caption1: States a dumb, frustrating, or unbelievable situation.

Caption2: Gives the reaction, continuation, or punchline that shows why Picard is facepalming.

examples.caption1: WE'RE OUT OF TOILET PAPER AGAIN
MY WIFE’S ACCENT IS SO BAD
examples.caption2: WHENEVER SHE YELLS AT THE KIDS SIRI COMES UP WITH AN ANSWER
IF YOU HAVE NOT WASHED YOUR HANDS

examples.caption1: WHEN I NOTICE THAT THE MAJORITY OF RESPONSES TO VEGAS SHOOTING LAST NIGHT
examples.caption2: ARE TO EXPRESS RACIAL OR RELIGIOUS HATE.

examples.caption1: WHEN YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT A MEME IS
examples.caption2: BUT YOU KEEP CALLING IT A FUNNY IMAGE

change_my_mind.name: Change My Mind
change_my_mind.explanation: This meme features a single caption, which states a controversial, unpopular, or opinionated statement that is intended to provoke a debate. The implied challenge is for others to 'change my mind' about the statement.

examples.caption1: Memes about how people make too many memes about coronavirus are technically memes about coronavirus
Asohka is a better female Jedi than Rey
We are all going to get old and die
I am not a simp for my own wife. Change my mind.

mocking_spongebob.name: Mocking Spongebob
mocking_spongebob.explanation: This meme features a two-part caption. Caption1 states a phrase or an idea. Caption2 is a mocking imitation of the first phrase, often with alternating capitalization, which conveys a sense of sarcasm or disrespect.

examples.caption1: When your mom tells you to clean your room
examples.caption2: wHeN YoUr mOm TeLlS yOu To cLeAn yOuR RoOm

examples.caption1: Don't think I don't see you there
examples.caption2: dOn't ThInk I DoN't sEe YoU ThErE

leonardo_dicaprio_cheers.name: Leonardo Dicaprio Cheers
leonardo_dicaprio_cheers.explanation: This meme shows Leonardo DiCaprio raising a glass. The first caption is usually a phrase like 'A toast to...' or 'Cheers to...' and the second caption is the object of the toast, often a group of people, a person, or an idea.

examples.caption1: To all those who are still working from home
A toast to all the teachers
examples.caption2: Who have to deal with us on a daily basis

is_this_a_pigeon.name: Is This A Pigeon
is_this_a_pigeon.explanation: This meme features a character pointing at a butterfly and asking 'Is this a pigeon?' Caption1 describes a person, group, or a self-referential label. Caption2 describes an object or concept, and Caption3 is the phrase 'Is this a [misidentified object]?'

inhaling_seagull.name: Inhaling Seagull
inhaling_seagull.explanation:
Caption1: Calm setup line introducing the situation.

Caption2: Builds on it with a little more detail or tension.

Caption3: Pushes the setup to peak anticipation (the “inhale” panel).

Caption4: Explosive or over-the-top reaction — the “scream” punchline.

ill_just_wait_here.name: I'll Just Wait Here
ill_just_wait_here.explanation: This meme features a two-part caption. Caption1 describes an action or a desired outcome, while Caption2 indicates the indefinite waiting period for that outcome. The image shows a character waiting patiently, often for something that is delayed or may never happen.

examples.caption1: Scrolling through Amazon, I have finally found it—toilet paper
examples.caption2: I see that it's out of stock

hide_the_pain_harold.name: Hide the Pain Harold
hide_the_pain_harold.explanation: The meme shows Harold, an older man, with a forced smile that suggests he is hiding internal pain or discomfort. Caption1 describes an awkward or painful situation, and Caption2 is a statement that attempts to make the best of it, with the image conveying the opposite emotion.

examples.caption1: You find a fresh meme to send to your friends

hard_to_swallow_pills.name: Hard To Swallow Pills
hard_to_swallow_pills.explanation: This meme features a single caption. The caption is a statement of an unpleasant, unpopular, or difficult-to-accept truth. The image of a person struggling to swallow a pill represents the difficulty of accepting this truth.

examples.caption1: No matter how many times you restart your computer, it will never love you.
No one will remember your username after you die.
Your phone will never get a new update.
There's no candy in the forest.

futurama_fry.name: Futurama Fry
futurama_fry.explanation: Caption1 states a situation or action, typically followed by the phrase 'Not sure if...' Caption2 completes the thought, expressing a dilemma or a skeptical conclusion.

examples.caption1: Not sure if the Coronavirus is ending
examples.caption2: or the news just stopped reporting on it

finding_neverland.name: Finding Neverland
finding_neverland.explanation: This meme features three panels of a character from the movie 'Finding Neverland' crying. Caption1 is a question, usually one that is seemingly simple, and Caption2 is an honest, often painful, answer. The third caption is the conclusion of the dialogue, which is usually a dramatic or even more depressing thought.

examples.caption1: I think I pooped in my pants
examples.caption3: U have loose motion?? don't panic. Now it's lockdown. Go behind the bush and wipe it with leaves

expanding_brain.name: Expanding Brain
expanding_brain.explanation: This meme shows a series of four images, each with an expanding brain. Caption1 represents a simple or common idea. Each subsequent caption represents a more complex, enlightened, or absurd version of the same idea.

examples.caption1: Using a spoon to eat soup
examples.caption2: Using a ladle to eat soup
examples.caption3: Drinking soup directly from the bowl
examples.caption4: Making a straw out of a breadstick

monkey_puppet.name: Monkey Puppet
monkey_puppet.explanation: Caption1 (Person 1): The setup or an action that is about to lead to a predictable but awkward outcome. Function: Sets the scene for the moment of realization. Caption2 (Monkey Puppet): The silent, knowing reaction of realizing the awkwardness or mistake. Function: The punchline, conveying a 'I know what I did' or 'this is awkward' sentiment without words.

examples.caption1: The teacher: 'You said the project was due today.'
examples.caption2: Me, who didn't do the project:

examples.caption1: My friend: 'Wait, did you really just say that?'

one_does_not_simply.name: One Does Not Simply
one_does_not_simply.explanation: Caption1 (Boromir): The iconic line establishing a task is not as easy as it seems. Function: Introduces the premise of a seemingly simple but unexpectedly difficult task. Caption2 (S.H.I.E.L.D. Agent): The difficult task itself. Function: The punchline, highlighting a mundane or modern-day 'quest' that is harder than it looks.

examples.caption2: find a good parking spot at the mall on a Saturday.
wake up early on a weekend.

sad_pablo_escobar.name: Sad Pablo Escobar
sad_pablo_escobar.explanation: Caption1: The reason for the wait or a moment of contemplation. Function: Sets up a situation where one is forced to wait or be alone. Caption2: A thought while waiting. Function: Adds to the sense of boredom or longing. Caption3: The final stage of sadness or extreme impatience. Function: The punchline, highlighting the prolonged or sad nature of the wait.

examples.caption1: Me waiting for my crush to text back.
Waiting for the pizza to arrive.
Sitting on the bench while my parents try on clothes.

see_nobody_cares.name: See Nobody Cares
see_nobody_cares.explanation: Caption1: A statement or news that someone thinks is important. Function: The setup for something that is ultimately insignificant to others. Caption2: The dismissal, 'See, nobody cares.' Function: The punchline, highlighting the indifference of the audience.

examples.caption1: Me: 'I just leveled up in my favorite video game!'
Coworker: 'I'm starting a new diet today!'
examples.caption2: The rest of the office: 'See, nobody cares.'

examples.caption1: My friend: 'I have a new tweet from J.K. Rowling.'

spongebob_ight_imma_head_out.name: Spongebob Ight Imma Head Out
spongebob_ight_imma_head_out.explanation: Caption1: The reason or event that prompts the departure. Function: Sets up an uncomfortable, boring, or unwanted situation. Caption2: The decision to leave. Function: The punchline, conveying a 'I'm out of here' attitude.

examples.caption1: When you hear your family start talking about politics at the dinner table.
When the teacher says attendance doesn't count for a grade.
When someone starts telling an awkward story.

surprised_pikachu.name: Surprised Pikachu
surprised_pikachu.explanation: Caption1: The action or setup that leads to a predictable result. Function: Establishes a cause-and-effect scenario. Caption2: The shocked reaction to the obvious outcome. Function: The punchline, highlighting the feigned or genuine surprise at a consequence that was easy to predict.

examples.caption1: Me: *eats an entire tub of ice cream*
examples.caption2: Me: *gets a stomach ache* Surprised Pikachu Face

examples.caption1: I didn't study for the test at all.
I told my mom I was going out but stayed home to play video games.
examples.caption2: My mom: *gets home and finds me playing video games* Surprised Pikachu Face

the_rock_driving.name: The Rock Driving
the_rock_driving.explanation: Caption1 (Person 1): A question or statement. Function: The setup for a conversational exchange. Caption2 (The Rock): A direct, often witty or surprising, response. Function: The punchline, subverting expectations with a clever or unexpected answer.

examples.caption2: I'm not procrastinating, I'm just taking my time.

examples.caption1: Are you talking back to me?
examples.caption2: Yes, that's how a conversation works.

the_scroll_of_truth.name: The Scroll Of Truth
the_scroll_of_truth.explanation: Caption1: A statement of fact or an opinion being revealed on the scroll. Function: The uncomfortable truth that the character will deny. Caption2: The character's violent reaction to the truth. Function: The punchline, highlighting the refusal to accept the reality.

examples.caption1: The movie you liked was actually bad.
You have to go to work.
You will say 'Nyeh' when you see this.

tuxedo_winnie_the_pooh.name: Tuxedo Winnie The Pooh
tuxedo_winnie_the_pooh.explanation: Caption1: A simple or casual version of a concept. Function: Establishes a baseline or common term. Caption2: A more formal, sophisticated, or overly-complex version of the same concept. Function: The punchline, highlighting the pretentious or unnecessarily elegant way of saying something simple.

examples.caption2: Me when I have a meeting on a Monday morning.
A black and white fat giant goat pig.
